definition: to tear up/to rip up/too shred
to destroy/to damage/to ruin/to defame/to slander

sentences.english: I tore up the note, got in the car and started driving.
sentences.chinese: 我撕毀遺書，坐到車裏，發動引擎。

sentences.english: Small qian incarnation book fairy meet, hand to tear to refuse his love poem.
sentences.chinese: 小倩化身簿仙子相見，一手將情詩撕毀拒絕他的情意。

sentences.english: Mr Trump intends to rip up the US-created global order.
sentences.chinese: 特朗普打算撕毀美國創建的全球秩序。

sentences.english: Several other international companies have also broken their leases, say property agents.
sentences.chinese: 據房產經濟介紹，其他幾個跨國公司也已撕毀租約。

sentences.english: No party who has signed the contract has the rught to break if.
sentences.chinese: 簽署合同的任何一方都無權撕毀合同。

sentences.english: Tearing up the social contract is something that should not be done lightly.
sentences.chinese: 撕毀社會契約是斷不該輕易去做的事情。

sentences.english: Some were still kicking at his likeness and tearing up his posters.
sentences.chinese: 一些人仍然在踢打着他的肖像，撕毀着他的宣傳畫。

sentences.english: YiXin tore up the contract in public, and that ended the cooperation with letters.
sentences.chinese: 毅昕當衆把合約撕毀，且聲言結束與信佳的合作。

sentences.english: You cannot break the contract without any good reason.
sentences.chinese: 假如沒有什麼正當理由，你們不應撕毀合同。

sentences.english: They ripped up the contract as soon as it was signed.
sentences.chinese: 剛剛簽好的合同他們就把它撕毀了。

sentences.english: North Korea is essentially tearing up the agreements that make the zone run.
sentences.chinese: 北韓方面實際上撕毀了工業園區賴以運作的合同。

sentences.english: They soon tore up the trade agreement.
sentences.chinese: 他們不久就撕毀了貿易協定。

sentences.english: It goes without saying that this campaign tore at the very soul of the Teke people.
sentences.chinese: 不用說，這項運動在特克人的靈魂撕毀。

sentences.english: The judge suggested that Shylock take the money that was offered by Bassanio and tear up the agreement.
sentences.chinese: 法官建議夏洛克拿着巴薩尼奧提供的錢，撕毀協議。

sentences.english: In international custom, a nation that unilaterally breaks contracts must make good the damage.
sentences.chinese: 慣例，某國單方面撕毀合同必須賠償損失。

sentences.english: We must immediately scrap the Indus Water Treaty completly.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須馬上撕毀印度河水條約。

definition: to execute by firing squad/same as 槍斃|枪毙
to eliminate/to sack/to remove from office
Edward Snowden (1983-), American surveillance program whistleblower
to sack/to remove from a position/to depose
to use violence (against sb)/to strong-arm sb/to manhandle
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
